subject: RE: [junit] Unit Testing vs Integration Testing
msgSnippet: ... Excellent point. One goal of Programmer Tests is defect isolation: one failing test means one problem, and so on. Take care. J. B. Rainsberger, President,
messageBody:
>So said Michael Holly on 2003-06-20 --------------------
>I'm fairly new to using junit, but I would suspect that the advantage of
>unit testing is getting a specific pointer to a section of code that has
>been confirmed as wrong.

Excellent point.

One goal of Programmer Tests is defect isolation: one failing test means one problem, and so on.

Take care.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
telephone: +1 416 791-8603
